question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 67] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker submit a transaction with version number >= 2^63 (i64::MAX), causing the cast `txn.info.version.0 as i64` to overflow into negative values, potentially corrupting the indexer database primary key and breaking foreign key constraints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 67] [Integer Overflow] If version overflows to a negative i64, could this cause the indexer to insert transactions with negative version numbers, breaking the UNIQUE constraint and allowing duplicate transaction entries with conflicting data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 79] [Integer Overflow] Can a malicious transaction with sequence_number >= 2^63 cause the cast `txn.request.sequence_number.0 as i64` to overflow, resulting in negative sequence numbers that could bypass the UNIQUE(sender, sequence_number) constraint and enable replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 79] [Sequence Number Manipulation] If sequence_number overflows to negative, could an attacker insert multiple transactions with the same (sender, negative_sequence_number) pair, violating nonce-based replay protection in the indexer's historical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 64] [Integer Overflow] Can block_height parameter overflow when passed as i64, causing transactions to be indexed at incorrect block heights and breaking the indexer's block-to-transaction mapping? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 65] [Integer Overflow] Can epoch parameter overflow to negative i64, causing transactions to be associated with invalid epochs and breaking epoch-based queries in the indexer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 80] [Numeric Overflow] Can u64_to_bigdecimal() conversion of max_gas_amount handle the full u64::MAX range without precision loss or overflow in the PostgreSQL NUMERIC type, or could extreme values corrupt gas accounting data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 85] [Numeric Overflow] Can u64_to_bigdecimal() conversion of gas_unit_price lose precision for very large values, causing incorrect gas cost calculations in indexer queries and breaking fee analytics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Lines 80, 85] [Data Integrity] If BigDecimal conversion silently truncates or rounds extreme u64 values, could this cause discrepancies between the indexer's gas data and the actual on-chain transaction data? (High)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 86] [Timestamp Edge Case] Can parse_timestamp() handle microsecond timestamps at the boundaries (0 or u64::MAX), or will it panic on edge cases causing indexer crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/user_transactions.rs] [Function: from_transaction(), Line 81-84] [Time Manipulation] Can an attacker craft transactions with expiration_timestamp_secs far in the future (but within MAX_TIMESTAMP_SECS) to poison indexer data and break time-based query filters?
